statement: Ecrade has an integer x. There are two kinds of operations. Replace x with ≤ft\lfloor \dfrac{x}{2}\right\rfloor, where ≤ft\lfloor \dfrac{x}{2}\right\rfloor is the greatest integer ≤ \dfrac{x}{2}. Replace x with ≤ft\lceil \dfrac{x}{2}\right\rceil, where ≤ft\lceil \dfrac{x}{2}\right\rceil is the smallest integer ≥ \dfrac{x}{2}. Ecrade will perform exactly n first operations and m second operations in any order. He wants to know the minimum and the maximum possible value of x after n+m operations. However, it seems a little difficult, so please help him!
input_specification: InputEach test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases t (1 ≤ t ≤ 10^4). The description of the test cases follows. The only line of each test case contains three integers x, n, and m (0 ≤ x, n, m ≤ 10^9).
output_specification: OutputFor each test case, print two integers in one line, representing the minimum and the maximum possible value of x after n + m operations.
note:
For simplicity, we call the first operation
OPER 1
and the second operation
OPER 2
